plugins.name: Asterisk
plugins.description:
Asterisk creates a personal knowledge system within your Figma files. Add context to any design element with custom tags, notes, and reference links. Quickly search and navigate to specific elements, making complex files manageable. Created for designers who want to add meaningful annotations to their file with contextual search to maintain clarity and effortless navigation.


üìù Add notes and custom tags to any layer in your file

üåê Add URLs to images for instant access to their source

üîç Find any element instantly with powerful search and filter functionality

‚ö° One-click navigation to any tagged element

*Ô∏è‚É£ Personalise your experience with fully customizable display options


*Free to use while in beta ~ provide feedback for lifetime free access üíö
plugins.tagline: *Add searchable notes, tags, and links to elements to organize, explore, and navigate effortlessly

plugins.name: NornAI - Boost Your Design and Content with AI
plugins.description:
üîÆ NornAI: Harness the power of artificial intelligence to transform and adapt your texts, adjusting tone and style to create unique and engaging designs. Inspired by mythology, this plugin offers a magical and personalized experience.




‚ú® Key Features


Text transformation with predefined tones: standard, success, error, call to action, and more.

Quick suggestions to summarize, expand, simplify, and make text more persuasive or friendly.

Image search and insertion with a special themed interface.



üõ†Ô∏è How to Use


1. Text Transformation

  1. Select the desired text.
  2. Choose a voice tone or quick suggestion.
  3. Use custom prompts for specific instructions.
  4. Click on one of the generated alternatives to apply.



2. Image Search

  1. Access the "Images" tab.
  2. Enter your search and optionally select a color filter.
  3. Click on an image to insert it into the project.
plugins.tagline: Enhance your design workfklow with AI

125952.name: NornAI - Boost Your Design and Content with AI
125952.description:
üîÆ NornAI: Harness the power of artificial intelligence to transform and adapt your texts, adjusting tone and style to create unique and engaging designs. Inspired by mythology, this plugin offers a magical and personalized experience.




‚ú® Key Features


Text transformation with predefined tones: standard, success, error, call to action, and more.

Quick suggestions to summarize, expand, simplify, and make text more persuasive or friendly.

Image search and insertion with a special themed interface.



üõ†Ô∏è How to Use


1. Text Transformation

  1. Select the desired text.
  2. Choose a voice tone or quick suggestion.
  3. Use custom prompts for specific instructions.
  4. Click on one of the generated alternatives to apply.



2. Image Search

  1. Access the "Images" tab.
  2. Enter your search and optionally select a color filter.
  3. Click on an image to insert it into the project.

networkAccess.reasoning: The plugin needs to access any domain because it fetches images from DuckDuckGo search results, which can come from any website. The image URLs are not known in advance and can be from any domain on the internet.

125952.tagline: Enhance your design workfklow with AI

plugins.name: Find & Replace Anything
plugins.description:
Search for anything on your page and replace it with anything you want!


A powerful tool for finding and replacing styles! Works with components, instances and library styles. Especially helpful to align parameters across projects in bulk like auto layout or library styles for your pixel perfect design.


Plugin is in active development. Therefore, any feedback is appreciated! Like our plugin? Leave a heart!


Full feature list:


Library & local Styles

  1. Fonts
  2. Colors
  3. Effects
  4. Grids


Variables (search only)

  1. Color Variable
  2. Number Variable
  3. String Variable
  4. Boolean Variable


Shape & Frame

  1. Name
  2. Width
  3. Height
  4. Position X
  5. Position Y
  6. Rotation
  7. Constrain Proportions
  8. Clip content


Text

  1. Text
  2. Font Size
  3. Paragraphs Spacing
  4. Paragraph Indent
  5. Text Decoration
  6. Text Case
  7. Text Resizing
  8. Text Align Horizontal
  9. Text Align Vertical


Layer

  1. Blend Mode
  2. Opacity
  3. Visibility


Stroke

  1. Stroke Align
  2. Stroke Weight
  3. Stroke Join


Auto Layout

  1. Layout mode
  2. Spacing between items
  3. Paddings
plugins.tagline: Search for anything on your page and replace it with anything you want!

plugins.name: Size Sync
plugins.description:
A convenient plugin for aligning sizes of multiple selected objects. Easily batch resize objects to match maximum/minimum widths or heights. Compatible with various objects including groups, frames, and shapes. Streamline your layout with 4 simple commands. Set up shortcuts for even faster workflow. Perfect for when you just need to match sizes without specifying exact width values - simple and efficient.

plugins.name: GridVar | Quick Column Grid with Variables
plugins.description:
GridVar helps you create width-based column layout grids with linked variables for any frame width. It automatically generates a set of variables representing different column configurations, including gutters, so you can quickly adjust and find the perfect fit for nested layers.


‚ú® Key Features:

‚Ä¢Quick Setup: Easily create layout grids with variable-based configurations.

‚Ä¢Flexible Widths: Effortlessly switch between column setups to match your design needs.

‚Ä¢Time-Saving: Eliminate manual calculations and streamline your workflow.


üìå How It Works:

Generated variables are conveniently stored in the "GridVar" variable collection. You can find the column width variables under: [Grid Name]/Columns.


Perfect for designers looking to simplify layout grid handling and enhance their Figma workflow.
plugins.tagline: GridVar: Width-based Layout Grids with Variables

124928.name: GridVar | Quick Column Grid with Variables
124928.description:

‚Ä¢Time-Saving: Eliminate manual calculations and streamline your workflow.


üìå How It Works:

Perfect for designers looking to simplify layout grid handling and enhance their Figma workflow.

manifest.name: GridVar | Quick Column Grid with Variables

parameters.name: Columns
parameters.description: Enter grid columns count or select preset

parameters.name: Gutter
parameters.description: Enter grid gutter or select preset

parameters.name: Margin
parameters.description: Enter grid margin or select preset

parameters.name: Width
parameters.description: Enter grid width or select preset

124928.tagline: GridVar: Width-based Layout Grids with Variables

plugins.name: Draft Alpha
plugins.description:
DraftAlpha ‚Äì Figma Plugin

Deliver consistent UX content aligned with your brand guidelines


DraftAlpha enables you to effortlessly create, collaborate, and maintain brand-consistent UX content directly within Figma.


Key Features:


‚úÖ AI-powered Brand Guidelines Builder

- Instantly generate tailored brand guidelines, including writing rules, tone of voice, target audience, and brand pillars.

- Customize guidelines precisely to reflect your brand identity.


‚úÖ Content Consistency & Compliance

- Automatically check content for adherence to your established brand guidelines.

- Generate multiple content variants aligned with your brand.


‚úÖ Centralized Content & Collaboration

- Single source of truth for all UX copy and team collaboration.

- Approval workflows, user roles, and content status management.

- Build reusable content components with localization support.


‚úÖ Seamless Localization

- Quickly generate brand-consistent localized content in 20+ languages.

- Manage and apply localization variants directly in Figma.


‚úÖ Integrated Figma Workflow

- Access your content library and apply content to designs instantly.

- Real-time brand guideline compliance checking within your design files.

- Effortlessly preview designs across multiple language variants.
plugins.tagline: Deliver UX Content consistent with brand guidelines

plugins.name: Find Duplicates
plugins.description: Effortlessly manage your Figma layers with this plugin that scans the root-level children of a selected node and identifies duplicates by name. Save time by automatically selecting all nodes with identical names, ensuring a clean and organized design structure. Ideal for designers working with complex hierarchies and naming conventions
plugins.tagline: Find and Select Nodes with Duplicate Names at Root Level

¬ß Sections

plugins.name: Speedy Proto
plugins.description: Create simple prototypes in one click, no matter how messy your Figma files are. Simply select multiple frames or a section containing frames, choose your animation settings and we will create a prototype in seconds. We ignore everything that is not a frame, so all your annotations, random bits of text and images will not mess up your prototype.
plugins.tagline: Lightning-fast prototypes in seconds

115950.name: Speedy Proto
115950.description: Create simple prototypes in one click, no matter how messy your Figma files are. Simply select multiple frames or a section containing frames, choose your animation settings and we will create a prototype in seconds. We ignore everything that is not a frame, so all your annotations, random bits of text and images will not mess up your prototype.

plugins.name: Resizer and Organizer

plugins.name: QuickToken
plugins.description:
QuickToken is the Figma plugin that enables instant variable import and seamless organization. Designed for designers who prioritize efficiency, QuickToken allows you to quickly insert variables into Figma‚Äôs local variables as design tokens. It supports collections and groups, keeping all variables clear and organized. Simplify your variable management and speed up your workflow with this powerful, efficient plugin!


Supported name schemes:


Create Variable Collection

#Collection


Create Variable Group

Group/


Create Variable

variable-name: value


The variable type recognition is automatically

based on the variable value itself.


Supported variable types


  1. Float 30
  2. Colors #333, #334455, rgb(0,100,100), rgba(2,2,2,0.1)
  3. Boolean: true, false
  4. String: 'Hello'
  5. Variable link: var(variable-name)

accepted.name: Roland Hidvegi
accepted.description: Roland Hidvegi is a Product Designer ‚Äî crafting digital experiences, from vision to final touches, passionate about creating things that make people happy.

plugins.tagline: Instant variable import and organization in Figma.

plugins.name: DxH - Layer2JSON
plugins.description: DxH - Layer2JSON is a Figma plugin by Devxhub Ltd. that exports design layers (text, images, shapes) to structured JSON format. Perfect for developers looking to integrate Figma designs into apps or workflows, it supports nested layers and exports essential design properties like size, position, and styles.

plugins.name: CopyCraft
plugins.description:
Streamline your text editing workflow with a powerful tool that helps you manage and edit text content across your Figma designs with precision and ease.

How it Works:


Text Loading:

Select any frame or text element in your Figma document and load it into the editor with a single click.


Smart Organization:

  1. Texts are automatically grouped by their parent elements (Frames, Components, or Groups)
  2. Each text element shows its character count and previous versions
  3. Intuitive interface for quick access to all text elements


Efficient Editing:

  1. Edit multiple text elements simultaneously
  2. Apply text styles directly from the editor
  3. Preview changes in real-time
  4. Navigate quickly to specific elements in your design


Key Features:

  1. Character counter for precise text control
  2. Previous version tracking for each text element
  3. Direct navigation to elements in your design
  4. Batch saving capabilities for groups of text
  5. Support for text styles application


Perfect for teams working on large-scale designs where maintaining text consistency and efficiency in editing is crucial.
plugins.tagline: Text Management Made Simple

plugins.name: Fijira
plugins.description:
Streamline your workflow and eliminate the gap between design and project management with Fijira. This powerful plugin seamlessly connects your Figma designs directly to your Jira tickets, ensuring that your development team always has access to the latest frames, feedback, and design specifications.


Stop wasting time manually exporting assets and pasting links. With Fijira, you can create detailed Jira comments, update ticket statuses, and link specific Figma frames directly from within your design file.


Key Features:


One-Click Jira Comments: Create rich, formatted comments in Jira tickets directly from Figma.

Automatic Frame Linking: Automatically attach a link to your selected Figma frame. If no frame is selected, you have the option to paste a link manually.

Status Updates: View available transitions and update the status of your Jira tickets without leaving Figma.

Simple Markdown Editor: Format your comments with bold, italics, lists, and links to keep your communication clear and organized.

Secure & Private: Your Jira credentials are saved securely in your local Figma storage and are never exposed. All communication happens through a secure, private proxy server.

Easy Setup: A simple, one-time setup for your Jira domain, email, and API token gets you started in minutes.

How to Use:


Run the Plugin: Open Fijira from the plugins menu.

Enter Your Settings: In the settings view, enter your Jira domain (e.g., your-company.atlassian.net), your Jira account email, and a valid Jira API token.

Select a Frame (Optional): Select a single frame in your Figma file that you want to link.

Fill in Commit Details: In the commit view, enter a commit title, a detailed description (using the markdown editor!), and the target Jira issue key (e.g., PROJ-123).

Update Status (Optional): Choose a new status for your Jira ticket from the dropdown menu.

Commit! Click "Commit & Update Jira". Fijira will post your comment, link, and status change to the specified Jira ticket and create a new version in your Figma file history.

Say goodbye to context switching and hello to a more efficient workflow with Fijira!
plugins.tagline: Sync your Figma designs with Jira issue, seamlessly.

plugins.name: FigJsonizer
plugins.description:
This plugin lets you select any frame or component in Figma and instantly convert it into a clean, structured JSON object. It's perfect for devs building UI components, syncing data with code, or generating design specs.


No network needed, no fluff‚Äîjust fast, reliable JSON export from your Figma canvas. Copy the data to clipboard and use it wherever your workflow takes you: React, Angular, JSON-based APIs‚Äîyou name it.


Ideal for design-to-dev handoff, prototyping, and frontend engineering.
plugins.tagline: Generate and copy clean JSON from selected Figma frames.

133815.name: FigJsonizer
133815.description:

No network needed, no fluff‚Äîjust fast, reliable JSON export from your Figma canvas. Copy the data to clipboard and use it wherever your workflow takes you: React, Angular, JSON-based APIs‚Äîyou name it.


Ideal for design-to-dev handoff, prototyping, and frontend engineering.
133815.tagline: Generate and copy clean JSON from selected Figma frames.

plugins.name: Text & Color to CSS Variables
plugins.description:
This plugin helps you generate clean, reusable CSS variables from selected Figma layers.

It supports both text styles and fill colors, and automatically converts them into:


@mixin snippets for font styles


:root CSS variables for color values (in HEX format)


Auto-detects color types like color-gray, color-blue, color-red, etc.


Prevents name duplication with numbered suffixes (e.g., --color-gray-1, --color-gray-2)


Sorts all variables in ascending order for better readability


Perfect for building design systems or exporting ready-to-use CSS from design files.
plugins.tagline: Extract text styles and fill colors from Figma layers and convert them into organized CSS variables.

131055.name: Text & Color to CSS Variables
131055.description:

It supports both text styles and fill colors, and automatically converts them into:

:root CSS variables for color values (in HEX format)

Prevents name duplication with numbered suffixes (e.g., --color-gray-1, --color-gray-2)


Sorts all variables in ascending order for better readability


Perfect for building design systems or exporting ready-to-use CSS from design files.
131055.tagline: Extract text styles and fill colors from Figma layers and convert them into organized CSS variables.

plugins.name: Detach Aliases
plugins.description:
Detach Aliases lets you resolve variable's aliased values from their sources. Easily detach a specific group of variables or all variables in a collection. You can target one mode at a time or all modes at once!


  1. Select your collection
  2. Select the target mode or all modes
  3. Enter the path to a group of variables or a single variable (see below for bulk actions)
  4. Detach


Tip

  1. Keep your variable window open to see the changes.
  2. Use the Refresh button to pull in changes to the variables made when the plugin window is open. (see below for copy & paste)
  3. Use clear to quickly delete the path.


Bulk Actions

You will most likely want to run this on a group or the entire collection:

  1. Update all variables within a group by entering the path/to/group
  2. Update all variables in the collection by entering / @all or @root in the path input
  3. You will see all variables which are located in the path and would have aliases detached in the preview panel on the left


Plugin Notes

  1. Variable names and paths are case sensitive
  2. Detaching variables, especially those linked to text styles may take longer to propagate


Copy/Paste Figma Bug

If you copy/paste variables between collections, you may need to reload the tab in order for those variables to register in their new collection.

accepted.name: Murph
accepted.description: Systems Designer ‚Ä¢ Plugin Author ‚Ä¢ Rectangle Lover

plugins.tagline: Break your collection aliases en masse!

plugins.name: Multi-edit Images
plugins.description: This simple plugin lets you select multiple images in a screen and change the Scale mode (Fit, Fill, Crop, Tile) or Blend mode (Normal, Darken, Multiple, etc...), all at once. This plugin only targets layers with an Image fill and ignores the rest.
plugins.tagline: Edit Scale and Blend modes for multiple images in one click

130460.name: Multi-edit Images
130460.description: This simple plugin lets you select multiple images in a screen and change the Scale mode (Fit, Fill, Crop, Tile) or Blend mode (Normal, Darken, Multiple, etc...), all at once. This plugin only targets layers with an Image fill and ignores the rest.

plugins.name: Easy Task Prioritiser
plugins.description:
Easy Task Prioritiser‚Ä®Quickly organize and rank your tasks using two proven prioritization frameworks ‚Äî right inside Figma.


‚ú® How It Works

üî¢ Stack Ranking

Go to the Stack tab.

Enter your list of tasks.

Click Start Comparison to begin.

You‚Äôll be shown two tasks at a time ‚Äî choose which is more important.

Repeat until all tasks are compared and ranked.

In the end:

You'll get a clear, ranked list of tasks

You can Copy to Clipboard or Push to Canvas to bring the list into your Figma file


üß† MoSCoW Prioritization

Switch to the MoSCoW tab.

Add your tasks.

For each task, select whether it‚Äôs a Must, Should, Could, or Won‚Äôt.

Once done, use Push to Canvas to generate a structured visual layout by category.

In the end:

You can Copy to Clipboard or Push to Canvas to see tasks grouped by priority


This plugin is perfect for product teams, designers, and facilitators who want to make prioritization decisions quickly ‚Äî and stay focused on what matters most.
plugins.tagline: Turn messy task lists into clear priorities.

plugins.name: Screenshot to 100%
plugins.description:
The plugin quickly scales selected images to 100% of their real screenshot size in one click.


On Windows, if your display scaling (for example, 175%) is set above 100%, screenshots are captured at a larger size and look incorrect when pasted into Figma. This plugin helps you downscale screenshots so they appear correctly in Figma.


To use the plugin properly, set the same scale value in the plugin settings as in your Windows display settings.

accepted.name: Nik M
accepted.description: UX/UI/Product designer with more than 10+ years exp.

plugins.tagline: The plugin quickly scales selected images to 100% of their real screenshot size in one click.

plugins.name: FileDetox
plugins.description: FileDetox is a powerful Figma cleanup tool that hunts down and eliminates the hidden clutter slowing down your design files. With its distinctive neo-brutalist interface, FileDetox quickly identifies hidden layers, empty frames, unused styles, and off-canvas elements that contribute to file bloat. In just a few clicks, purge unnecessary elements and optimize your workflow. Design with intention, not with digital baggage. Made by gautham.
plugins.tagline: Design Detoxification. Simplified.

In just a few clicks, purge unnecessary elements and optimize your workflow. Design with intention, not with digital baggage. Made by gautham.

plugins.name: howly-figma-plugin
plugins.description:
1. The exported tokens in JSON file follow Design Tokens Properties format.
  2. Each Mode in the Collection exports an independent JSON file.
  3. Collection and Mode names are transformed to kebab-case.
  4. JSON file name follows pattern: {collection-name}.{mode-name}.tokens.json
plugins.tagline: Export design tokens to JSON

plugins.name: Mode Match
plugins.description:
Mode Match lets you take a variable's value from one mode and apply it to other modes. Match a single variable, group of variables, or all variables in a collection!


  1. Select your multi-mode collection
  2. Select the source mode (copy from)
  3. Select the destination mode (copy to)
  4. Enter the path to a group of variables or a single variable (see below for bulk actions)
  5. Update ‚ú®


Tip

  1. Keep your variable window open to see the changes.
  2. Use the Refresh button to pull in changes to the variables made when the plugin window is open. (see below for copy & paste)
  3. Use clear to quickly delete the path.


Bulk Actions

You will most likely want to run this on a group or the entire collection:

  1. Update all variables within a group by entering a path/to/group
  2. Update all variables in the collection by entering / @all or @root in the path input


Plugin Notes

  1. Collection list will only show collections with more than 1 mode
  2. Variable names and paths are case sensitive
  3. Updating variables, especially those linked to text styles may take longer to propagate


Supports

  1. All variable types (number, string, boolean, color)
  2. Aliasing
  3. Raw values


Copy/Paste Figma Bug

If you copy/paste variables between collections, you may need to reload the tab in order for those variables to register in their new collection.

accepted.name: Murph
accepted.description: Systems Designer ‚Ä¢ Plugin Author ‚Ä¢ Rectangle Lover

plugins.tagline: Match variable values across modes.

plugins.name: Icons to GitLab
plugins.description:
This plugin can help you export SVG from Figma directly to a GitLab repository.


It currently supports the following features:

- Export the selected components or instances to GitLab

- If the file already exists in the repository, it will be updated
plugins.tagline: Export SVG from Figma directly to a GitLab repository

plugins.name: Obliviate
plugins.description: This plugin will automatically select all the text layers within current selection and will bulk update those with either the new text provided or with empty text values to clean the design.
plugins.tagline: Clean all garbage text or bulk update it

plugins.name: Keyword-Based Ungrouper
plugins.description: This plugin allows you to ungroup elements in your Figma design based on user-specified keywords. Simply input the keywords, and the plugin will automatically find and ungroup all elements that match the criteria. Enhance your design workflow by quickly managing grouped elements with precision.
plugins.tagline: Ungroup elements based on specified keywords

115692.name: Keyword-Based Ungrouper
115692.description: This plugin allows you to ungroup elements in your Figma design based on user-specified keywords. Simply input the keywords, and the plugin will automatically find and ungroup all elements that match the criteria. Enhance your design workflow by quickly managing grouped elements with precision.
115692.tagline: Ungroup elements based on specified keywords

plugins.name: MoveQuack
plugins.description:
Feature Overview

This plugin allows users to set customizable timers for both work and break periods, catering to individual needs.


Key Features

Customizable Timer: Set specific times for work and rest, with full flexibility.

Timed Reminders: Automatically alerts users when it's time to take a break, preventing overwork.

Boost Efficiency and Health: Helps maintain high productivity while ensuring overall well-being.


Use Cases

Perfect for users who engage in long work or study sessions, especially for professionals like designers and developers who need regular breaks.
plugins.tagline: Break Reminder Timer

115542.description:

plugins.name: Import Lospec palette
plugins.description:
Create color styles from Lospec palette URL


How to use:

  1. Enter the Lospec palette URL (for example https://lospec.com/palette-list/resurrect-64) in the text input.
  2. Click on 'Import palette'.


---

plugins.name: Synchronize Frames
plugins.description:
This program enhances efficiency in Figma by allowing users to synchronize frames automatically. It ensures that any modifications made to a selected frame are instantly reflected in all corresponding frames, promoting consistency across designs. The user interface features intuitive buttons to assign frames, toggle synchronization, and activate auto-sync capabilities.


To automatically search for frames for synchronization, the "SS_" tag must be specified before the frame name.
plugins.tagline: Seamlessly synchronize your design frames for a more efficient workflow

113339.name: Synchronize Frames
113339.description:
This program enhances efficiency in Figma by allowing users to synchronize frames automatically. It ensures that any modifications made to a selected frame are instantly reflected in all corresponding frames, promoting consistency across designs. The user interface features intuitive buttons to assign frames, toggle synchronization, and activate auto-sync capabilities.


To automatically search for frames for synchronization, the "SS_" tag must be specified before the frame name.
113339.tagline: Seamlessly synchronize your design frames for a more efficient workflow
